misdeed: A string of unsettling incidents plague a small town: people are driven to fits of rage or melancholy; accidents occur with alarming frequency; and whispers of deals with a dark entity circulate in hushed tones.
solution: The Vaesen is a Spertus, and it can only be removed by a ritualistic sacrifice of a dozen souls or by the afflicted devoting their life to the Church.

clues.description: Those affected by the strange occurrences often speak of a small, insect-like creature that whispers promises of power, wealth, or love in their ear.
A strange compulsion drives people to seek out a particular antique snuff box, believing it holds the key to their desires.
Those who succumb to the entity's influence exhibit increasingly erratic behavior, their bodies often marked with unusual blemishes or deformities.
A local shopkeeper claims to have unknowingly purchased a cursed item from a traveling merchant, one that seems to bring misfortune to all who possess it.
The air around those affected by the entity feels heavy and charged, as if an unseen presence feeds on their desperation.
A faint, sulfurous odor seems to cling to those who have made bargains with the entity, growing stronger with each passing day.

plotTwist.description: The town's seemingly benevolent doctor is secretly the third owner of the Vaesen, using its power to manipulate his patients and maintain control over the community.
